newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: Ericsson wins $11.9 mln Bahrain deal.
newsitem.headline: Ericsson wins $11.9 mln Bahrain deal.

text.p: Bahrain Telecommunication Company (Batelco) said on Saturday it had signed a 4.5 million dinar ($11.9 million) deal with Sweden's Ericsson to expand its Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) network.
A Batelco statement said work on the project, to expand the network to 80,000 lines from 35,000 now, would start early next year and was scheduled for completion by July 1998.
"The GSM expansion project will enable Batelco to meet the increasing demand for mobile telephone services in Bahrain," a Batelco spokesman said in the statement.

Batelco, which has one of the most advanced networks in the region, is 39 percent owned by the Bahraini government and 20 percent by Cable and Wireless Plc of Britain. The remaining equity is held by investors and financial institutions.
